content: Just curious if the meeting topics are visible anywhere in advance for non-team members. A lot of the links point to removed sections of the lang-team repo's README (for example, the link from the lang-team calendar) so it's not clear if that info is supposed to exist or not

For the design meetings? Those should be on the calendar, like https://calendar.google.com/calendar/event?eid=Y2JuMml0cmNlanVhMWJmNWVpNjA0dGlmOG1fMjAyMDExMDRUMTgwMDAwWiByZWN1ZDRiOW84Y21jMG01cm1yMDMzcDVua0Bn&ctz=America/New_York
(Which is apparently linked from https://lang-team.rust-lang.org/calendar.html -- a URL I didn't know existed until now.)

Actually I was referring to the triage meeting - the calendar invite says:

The triage meeting for the language design team. Topics are selected and posted in advance. For details, see notes here:

But the link is broken
Though I'm trying to get better about posting and preparing the agenda
I post an agenda in the form of a hackmd in the "triage meeting" topic of #t-lang
huh, Zulip is just unable to link to that topic for some reason
No worries - you mentioned at the start for people attending to write their name down and I wasn't sure if that document was linked somewhere - I couldn't find it beforehand
this is kind of unavoidable, as we want to categorize nominations
Yeah, let me update the calendar invite to have more accurate information
and I can post the hackmd link into zoom also

nikomatsakis said:

this is kind of unavoidable, as we want to categorize nominations

sorry, I mean: as we want to include nominations from over the previous week
Also, the set of folks on that invite is a bit odd.. it looks like @scottmcm you're not on there :)
not sure if you want to be
Ah yeah I was not subscribed to #t-lang somehow despite being subscribed to the other topics, maybe there is something weird with that topic...
